content: Fe-MOFs (Fe-MIL-88NH2) were prepared based on the reported work with slight modification. First, 0.187 g of FeCl3·6H2O and 0.126 g of 2-aminoterephthalic acid were fully dissolved in 15 mL of DMF. Then, 197 μL of acetic acid was added to the solution under stirring. Subsequently, this mixture was heated at 120 °C for 4 h using an oil bath. The Fe-MOFs were obtained by centrifugation (8000 rpm, 10 min) and washed three times by DMF and ethanol to remove excessive reactants. Finally, the Fe-MOFs were dried at 60 °C overnight and kept at 4 °C.
clean_text:
Preparation of Immune Fe-MOF/PtNPs

Fe-MOFs (Fe-MIL-88NH2) were prepared based on the reported work with slight modification. First, 0.187 g of FeCl3⋅6H2O and 0.126 g of 2-aminoterephthalic acid were fully dissolved in 15 mL of DMF. Then, 197 μL of acetic acid was added to the solution under stirring. Subsequently, this mixture was heated at 120 °C for 4 h using an oil bath. The Fe-MOFs were obtained by centrifugation (8000 rpm, 10 min) and washed three times by DMF and ethanol to remove excessive reactants. Finally, the Fe-MOFs were dried at 60 °C overnight and kept at 4 °C.
